sen.j: 伏見宮貞常親王（ふしみのみや さだつねしんのう、応永32年12月19日 （1426年1月27日） - 文明 6年7月3日 （1474年8月15日））は、室町時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadatsune (January 27, 1426 - August 15, 1474) was the Imperial family member during the Muromachi period.
Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadatsune (January 27, 1426 - August 15, 1474) was an Imperial family member during the Muromachi period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadatsune (January 27, 1426 - August 15, 1474) was an Imperial family member during the Muromachi period.
He received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) and Shikibukyo. (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonial)
He received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) and Shikibukyo (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).
He received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) and Shikibukyo (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).

sen.j: 世襲親王家、伏見宮第4代当主。
sen.e: He was the hereditary Imperial family and the fourth family head of Fushiminomiya family.
He was a member of the hereditary Imperial family and the fourth family head of Fushiminomiya family.
He was a member of the hereditary Imperial family and the fourth family head of Fushiminomiya family.
Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 伏見宮貞成親王第二王子。
sen.e: He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadafusa.
He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadafusa.
He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadafusa.

sen.j: 母は庭田家経有（宇多源氏）の娘、源幸子（敷政門院）。
sen.e: His mother was Tsuneari's daughter (NIWATA) (the Uda Genji), who was from the Niwata family, MINAMOTO no Yukiko. (Fuseimonin)
His mother was Tsuneari's daughter (NIWATA) (the Uda Genji), who was from the Niwata family, MINAMOTO no Yukiko. (Fuseimonin)
His mother was Tsuneari NIWATA's daughter, who was from the Niwata family (Uda-Genji, Minamoto clan), MINAMOTO no Yukiko (Fuseimonin).
sen.cmt: Tsuneari NIWATAとしました。括弧書きの位置を訂正。Minamoto clan 補足しました。

sen.e: His brother was Emperor Gohanazono.
His brother was Emperor Gohanazono.
His brother was Emperor Gohanazono.

sen.j: 御息所は庭田重有の娘、源盈子。
sen.e: His Miyasudokoro (lady of the bedchamber) was Shigeari NIWATA's daughter, MINAMOTO no Mitsuko.
His Miyasudokoro (lady of the bedchamber) was Shigeari NIWATA's daughter, MINAMOTO no Mitsuko.
His Miyasudokoro (lady of the bedchamber) was Shigeari NIWATA's daughter, MINAMOTO no Mitsuko.
Career
Career
Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: "Career" -> "Brief Personal History" に変更しました。

sen.j: 文安元年（1444年）に親王宣下、翌文安2年（1445年）に元服、寛正5年（1464年）に二品。
sen.e: He received to title to become Imperial Prince in 1444 and had coming-of-ceremony in 1445, and received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) in 1464.
He received the title Imperial Prince in 1444 and had a coming-of-age-ceremony in 1445, and received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) in 1464.
He received the title Imperial Prince in 1444 and had a coming-of-age-ceremony in 1445, and received Nihon (the second rank of Imperial Prince) in 1464.

sen.j: 康正2年（1456年）に兄である後花園天皇から、永世「伏見殿御所（伏見殿）」と称することを勅許され、以降は伏見宮と名乗るようになった。
sen.e: In 1456 his older brother, Emperor Gohanazono gave permission for him to name 'Fushimidono Gosho (Fushimidono)' after that he named Fushinomiya.
In 1456 his older brother, Emperor Gohanazono gave permission for him to name 'Fushimidono Gosho (Fushimidono)' after that he was named Fushinomiya.
In 1456 his older brother, Emperor Gohanazono gave permission for him to name 'Fushimidono Gosho' (Fushimidono) after that he was named Fushinomiya.
sen.cmt: 括弧書きの位置を訂正しました。

sen.e: The cemetery
The cemetery
The cemetery

sen.j: 菩提所は京都市左京区の相国寺、伏見宮墓地。
sen.e: His family temple was Shokoku-ji Temple in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto city.
His family temple is Shokoku-ji Temple in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto city.
His family temple is Shokoku-ji Temple in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
